Shift+Click an object to attract viewers' attention
Press Alt+Enter to switch to fullscreen mode
{0} is temporarily in charge of the debriefing
You are temporarily in charge of the debriefing
A valid password is required for this connection
Establish a connection with a data recorder to review telemetry data in real-time!
Only the Advanced edition of Tacview can record real-time telemetry.
A password may be required to join a private session
Failed to connect real-time telemetry to given host address.
Real-time telemetry not compatible with the host exporter.
Playback is currently not synchronized with real-time telemetry.
Import Falcon 4 *.flt files to review telemetry data in real-time!

As soon as your Falcon 4 flight has started, press the [F] key to start recording data. Falcon will generate *.flt files which will be read by Tacview and displayed in real-time in the 3D view.
*** NOTES ***
• You might want to force Falcon to inject colors and callsigns by pressing twice the [F] key during the flight. • Starting with BMS 4.36 Update 1, you need to set g_bTacviewAcmi 0 in "Falcon BMS User.cfg" file to create *.flt files.
Please select the Acmi folder where Falcon 4.0 stores its VHS And FLT files.
Listens to 1090MHz ADS-B radio signals to display aircraft around you in real-time!

Cannot find any supported USB radio device to read ADS-B signal. Check https://www.rtl-sdr.com for a list of RTL2832U compatible radio equipment, and make sure WinUSB is properly installed from https://zadig.akeo.ie

To record ADS-B radio signal in real-time, you need:
• RTL2832U compatible USB radio dongle (https://www.rtl-sdr.com) • 1090MHz antenna • 1090MHz ADS-B filter (optional) • WinUSB drivers for your dongle (https://zadig.akeo.ie)
Make sure everything is properly connected to your computer and configured, then click connect!
